entry.title: Keiko Diary for 2006-Apr-04
entry.content:
This is the first of my keiko (karate practice) diary entries.

Sensei took advantage of the fact that no little kids were there to concentrate on training and conditioning. Everyone did stairstepped pushups, kicking line drills and practicing moving into an oblique position by taking a fighting stance, moving the back foot up (without raising the head) and moving the other foot back so that the body is on a 45° angle.

We worked on basic fighting technique, specifically using the swap-jump to better position ourselves for a counterattack.

  1. Attacker and defender in closed fighting stances.
  2. Attacker reverse punches to chest.
  3. Defender perries punch downward while sliding back (ala ipon kumite #3).
  4. Attacker uses swap-jump to position obliquely while raising an easy middle defend. Attacker then steps in, lowers and attacks ribs.

We also studied a few terms:

Atemi
Vital strike. "Soft target" one can hit to down an attacker
Kime
Focus
Mai-ai
Interval. Maintaining the proper distance with an opponent
Zanshin
Remaining mind; After finishing an action, keeping concentration for what might happen next

entry.title: Kwanmu!
entry.content:
My son and I have been taking karate lessons weekly for about three and half years now. And every week there are new techniques to be learned and previously-taught techniques to be relearned or improved.

My thought is to use this blog to capture some of these ideas so that I can efer back to them later. Posts will be filed under the Kwanmukan category.

Kwanmu, by the way, is Japanese for "realization of the essential."
